title: Verb た-form
explanation: The た-form is made by changing て/で of the て-form into た/だ respectively.

title: Vた-form ことがあります ( have the experience of V-ing ... )
explanation: Used to describe one's past experiences. Different from simply stating what was done at a certain time.

examples.japanese: 馬に乗ったことがあります。
去年北海道で馬に乗りました。
examples.english: I rode a horse in Hokkaido last year.

title: Vた-formり、Vた-formりします ( V ..and V .., and so on )
explanation: Used to list representative actions among many. Unlike the て-form sequence, this pattern does not show time order but gives examples.

examples.japanese: 日曜日はテニスをしたり、映画を見たりします。
examples.english: On Sundays I play tennis, see a movie and so on.

examples.japanese: 日曜日はテニスをしたり、映画を見たりしました。
examples.english: Last Sunday I played tennis, saw a movie and so on.

examples.japanese: 日曜日はテニスをして、映画を見ました。
examples.english: Last Sunday I played tennis and then saw a movie.

title: い-adj → ~くなります / な-adj [な] → ~になります / Nに なります ( become ... )
explanation: なります means 'become' and indicates changes in state or condition.

examples.japanese: 寒い → 寒くなります
元気[な] → 元気になります

title: そうですね
explanation: そうですね is used to agree or sympathize with what someone said. Different from そうですか, which expresses realization or surprise at new information.
